revised_title: Hydrogen Absorption and Its Effects on Iron and Steel
tldr: The author investigates the effects of hydrogen absorption on iron and steel when exposed to acids. They observe a decrease in toughness and an increase in weight, which is more pronounced in steel. The author also notes the absence of frothing in steel, which they attribute to its different molecular structure and the occlusion of more gas. The study aims to understand the cause of these changes and their potential implications.
scientific_discipline: Materials Science > Corrosion and Materials Failure
